contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox company |company_name = Kirk Manufacturing Company |company_logo = [[File:Yale-auto 1905 logo.jpg|200px]] |company_type = Automobile Manufacturing |genre = Touring cars<ref name="duns">{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=iskpAAAAYAAJ&pg=RA8-PA84&lpg=RA8-PA84&dq=Pierce,+Butler+%26+Pierce+Mfg,+Co.,+Syracuse,+NY,+USA+-+The+Largest+Plant+in+the+World+for+the+Exclusive+Manufacture+of+Heating+and+Sanitary+Apparatus&source=bl&ots=9a9HFEa5ms&sig=MK6MH9edCfBFoDiZB50emEQp-hA&hl=en&ei=hbAOTvaMFqrt0gHK1rCtDg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBYQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=syracuse&f=false|title=Dun's Review|first= |last= |accessdate=July 2, 2011 |work=|publisher=R. G. Dun & Company, [[New York, New York]], March, 1904 p. 55}}</ref> |foundation = |founder = |fate = |location_city = [[Toledo, Ohio]] |location_country = [[United States]] |key_people = |area_served = [[United States]] |industry = [[Automotive industry|Automotive]] |products = [[Automobiles|Vehicles]]<br />[[Automotive parts]] |services = |market cap = |revenue = |operating_income = |net_income = |assets = |equity = |num_employees = |title = |parent = |divisions = |subsid = |owner = |homepage = |defunct = |footnotes = }} '''Kirk Manufacturing Company''' was a manufacturer of [[Brass Era car|Brass Era]] [[automobile]]s in [[Toledo, Ohio]] from 1901 to 1905. Their automobile was marketed as the '''Yale'''.<ref name="leslies">{{cite book|title=Frank Leslie's Popular Monthly |first=Frank |last=Leslie |accessdate=August 12, 2011 |work=|publisher=January, 1904}}</ref> It should not be confused with the Yale automobile made in Saginaw, Michigan from 1916 to 1918. ==History== The 1904 ''Yale'' was a [[touring car]]. Equipped with a [[tonneau]], the basic model could seat 5 passengers and sold for [[USD|US$]]1500. The car's engine was a horizontally-mounted water-cooled [[flat-2]], mid-mounted, which produced 16 hp (11.9 kW). It powered the wheels through a 2-speed transmission. The car weighed 1800 lb (816 kg).<ref name="leslies"/> A model with a 30 hp (22.4 kW) engine sold for US$2500.<ref name="leslies"/> A 12-horsepower Yale [[touring car]] was also sold in 1904 for [[USD|US$]]1700. It was advertised nationally that year in ''Dun's Review'' as "the simplest, safest and most economical touring car made in America."<ref name="duns"/> ==Advertisements== [[File:Yale-auto 1904.jpg|thumb|400px|center|Kirk Manufacturing Company - The Yale Touring Car - 1904]] ==External links== * ''Frank Leslie's Popular Monthly'' (January, 1904) ==References== {{Commons category|Yale vehicles}} {{reflist}} [[Category:Brass Era vehicles]] [[Category:1904 introductions]] [[Category:Motor vehicle manufacturers based in Ohio]] {{motorvehicle-company-stub}}
